reviews.text: Recently rebuilt main entrance and ticket office look great. New waiting areas at platform level are comfortable and offer shelter from the elements.
Well worth a visit to Dundee, plenty to see & The V&A adds value. Had some great food in their 2nd floor restaurant.

The new station is fantastic! It’s very modern and bright. There are now seats in the street level foyer next to the ticket office and the taxi rank is right next to the side entrance/exit. The V&A and city centre are only a few minutes walk away and the station is served by the numbers 42, 54, 77, 99 and 360 buses. The also new ScotRail waiting room is good too with plenty seats but could do with a few more plugs for charging. The platforms are light and airy but sheltered enough for waiting outside. The coffee shop is a welcome addition too! I have found it to be quite dirty later in the day but much cleaner in the mornings but I guess that’s what happens at busy stations.

Staff member rude and unhelpful upon us finding out our £29 return tickets had to be used on the same day purchased therefore return ticket of no use. That was bad enough but no guidance, he  just walked away stating quite bluntly we would have to purchase another ticket.  Lovely station but need to work on customer relationships.Woman at desk was lovely 😁
the new train station looks great... the waiting rooms are comfortable :)
